Package it.polimi.ingsw.view.gui.ui

Class JCellButton

java.lang.Object
java.awt.Component
java.awt.Container
javax.swing.JComponent
javax.swing.AbstractButton
javax.swing.JButton
it.polimi.ingsw.view.gui.ui.JCellButton
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.ItemSelectable, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.SwingConstants
public class JCellButton
extends javax.swing.JButton
This class defines a button which is used in RealGame phase. When a match starts, cells can have different levels: GROUND, ONE, TWO, THREE
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • JCellButton

      public JCellButton​(Worker worker, BlockType blockLevel, int row, int col)
      This is the creator of the class. At the moment of creation:
      Parameters:
      worker - contains a reference of a Worker. If no worker is in referred cell it would be null
      blockLevel - contains information about the level of the cell
      row - is an integer which indicates the number of row which identifies the cell in the Board
      col - is an integer which indicates the number of column which identifies the cell in the Board

  • Method Details

    • getWorker

      public Worker getWorker()
      This method is a simple getter of the Worker inside the cell.
      Returns:
      a Worker if inside a cell

    • setWorker

      public void setWorker​(Worker worker)
      This method is a simple setter of the class.
      Parameters:
      worker - contains a reference of the worker that is in the cell

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      This method is a getter of the boolean attribute of the class.
      Returns:
      true if the cell doesn't contains any worker inside, false otherwise.

    • setEmpty

      public void setEmpty​(boolean isEmpty)
      This method is a simple setter of the boolean attribute of the cell
      Parameters:
      isEmpty - is a boolean value which if true indicates that no worker is in the cell.

    • getWorkerLabel

      public javax.swing.JLabel getWorkerLabel()
      This method is a simple getter of the class.
      Returns:
      a JLabel which indicates the presence of a worker in the cell.

    • setWorkerLabel

      public void setWorkerLabel​(javax.swing.JLabel workerLabel)
      This method is a simple setter of the class attribute workerLabel.
      Parameters:
      workerLabel - contains an image which indicates the presence of a worker

    • getRow

      public int getRow()
      This is a simple getter of the integer number which identifies the column of the cell related to the button
      Returns:
      the integer number which identifies the cell row in the board.

    • getCol

      public int getCol()
      This is a simple getter of the integer number which identifies the column of the cell related to the button
      Returns:
      the integer number which identifies the cell column in the board.

    • paintComponent

      protected void paintComponent​(java.awt.Graphics g)
      This method is used to set the background of the cell.
      Overrides:
      paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent
      Parameters:
      g - contains a reference to the button of which we want to set the background

    • computeImage

      private java.awt.Image computeImage() throws java.io.IOException
      This private method computes the image that will be set as background image of the button
      Returns:
      an Image which would be used as background
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - when some error is encountered while getting the needed resources
